original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Save for retirement starting with your first paycheck...

Our Meditation for Today:

Although He was a Son, he learned obedience from
what He suffered...(Heb. 5:8) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Jesus' human life was not a script that He passively followed.
It was a life He chose freely (Jn. 10:17, 18)...

It was a continuous process of making the will of God the Father
His own. Jesus chose to obey, even though obedience led to
suffering and death...

Because Jesus obeyed perfectly, even under great trial, He can 
help us obey, no matter how difficult obedience seems to be...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, guide and direct me in thy will...
I pray that through obedience my life would be an example
of You living with-in me...Protect our troops today I pray...
Help them recognize those who wish to do them harm...
Be with those who are innocently caught in the middle of this
war...I pray for the day that peace will reign eternal...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: Jesus' human life was not a script that He passively followed. It was a life He chose freely (John 10:17, 18). It was a continuous process of making the will of God the Father His own. Jesus chose to obey, even though obedience led to suffering and death. Because Jesus obeyed perfectly, even under great trial, He can help us obey, no matter how difficult obedience seems to be.
original_verse_text: Although He was a Son, he learned obedience from what He suffered.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, marveling at the example of Your Son, Jesus Christ. He willingly embraced the path of obedience, even when it led to suffering and death on the cross. Grant us the strength and courage to follow in His footsteps, to make Your will our own, and to trust in Your perfect plan, no matter the cost. May we find comfort and hope in the knowledge that through Christ's obedience, we can overcome the trials and tribulations of this world. We ask this in the name of our Savior, Jesus Christ. Amen.
reflection: Jesus's human life was not a script that He passively followed. It was a life He chose freely (John 10:17, 18). It was a continuous process of making the will of God the Father His own. Jesus chose to obey, even though obedience led to suffering and death. Because Jesus obeyed perfectly, even under great trial, He can help us obey, no matter how difficult obedience seems to be.
subject: Choosing Obedience, Even in Suffering
verse_text: Although He was a Son, he learned obedience from what He suffered.

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Make peace with the past so it won't screw up the present.

Our Meditation for Today:

And, once made perfect, He became the source of salvation
for all who obey Him...(Heb. 5:9) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Christ was always morally perfect. By obeying, He demonstrated
His perfection to us, not to God or to Himself,,,

In the Bible. perfection usually means completeness or maturity...

By sharing our experience of suffering, Christ shared our human
experience completely. He is now able to offer eternal salvation
to those who obey Him...

Look to Phil. 2:5-11 and you will see Christ's attitude as He took
on human form...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I am so thankful for what You 
were will to do for me. I thank You for the amazing love
You demonstrated in going the way of the cross in my
place...Help me to demonstrate a Christ-like love in my
daily walk...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: Christ was always morally perfect. By obeying, He demonstrated His perfection to us, not to God or to Himself, , , In the Bible. perfection usually means completeness or maturity. By sharing our experience of suffering, Christ shared our human experience completely. He is now able to offer eternal salvation to those who obey Him. Look to Philippians 2:5-11 and you will see Christ's attitude as He took on human form.
original_verse_text: And, once made perfect, He became the source of salvation for all who obey Him.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You in humble reverence, marveling at the perfect obedience and selfless humility of Your Son, our Lord Jesus Christ. As He willingly took on human form, enduring suffering and death, He demonstrated the fullness of Your love and the path to eternal salvation. Help us, Lord, to have the same attitude as Christ, putting aside our own desires and following in His footsteps of faithful obedience. May we find strength and comfort in the knowledge that through Christ's perfect sacrifice, we can receive the gift of eternal life. Amen.
reflection: Christ was always morally perfect. By obeying, He demonstrated His perfection to us, not to God or to Himself. In the Bible, perfection usually means completeness or maturity. By sharing our experience of suffering, Christ shared our human experience completely. He is now able to offer eternal salvation to those who obey Him. Look to Philippians 2:5-11, and you will see Christ's attitude as He took on human form.
subject: The Perfection of Christ's Obedience
verse_text: And, once made perfect, He became the source of salvation for all who obey Him.

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~It's OK to let your children see you cry~~~

Our Meditation for Today: (warning against falling away)

We have much to say about this, but it is hard to explain because
you are slow to learn...

In fact, though by this time you ought to be teachers, you need someone to teach you the elementary truths of God's Word all over again.
You need milk, not solid food!

Anyone who lives on milk, being still an infant, is not acquainted with 
the teaching about righteousness...(Heb. 5:11-13) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

What Paul was saying here is that these Jewish Christians were immature.
Paul says that by this time they should have been teaching others, but they
had not applied the basics to their own lives...

They were reluctant to move beyond their old traditions, their established
doctrines, and discussions of the basics..

Paul is saying they wouldn't be able to understand the high-priestly role of
Christ unless they moved out of their comfort zone. They would have to cut
some of their Jewish ties, and stop trying to blend in with their culture...

If we are truly committed to Christ He will move us out of our comfort zone...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I pray for a greater maturity of my faith in You...
Help me to move into a life totally committed to You...
Help me to apply all that I learn so that I may be of greater use to You...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: What Paul was saying here is that these Jewish Christians were immature. Paul says that by this time they should have been teaching others, but they had not applied the basics to their own lives. They were reluctant to move beyond their old traditions, their established doctrines, and discussions of the basics. Paul is saying they wouldn't be able to understand the high-priestly role of Christ unless they moved out of their comfort zone. They would have to cut some of their Jewish ties, and stop trying to blend in with their culture. If we are truly committed to Christ He will move us out of our comfort zone.
original_verse_text: We have much to say about this, but it is hard to explain because you are slow to learn. In fact, though by this time you ought to be teachers, you need someone to teach you the elementary truths of God's Word all over again. You need milk, not solid food! Anyone who lives on milk, being still an infant, is not acquainted with the teaching about righteousness...
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging our tendency to cling to the familiar and resist the growth You desire for us. Forgive us for being slow to apply the foundational truths of Your Word to our lives. Lord, grant us the courage to move beyond our comfort zones, to let go of our old traditions and established doctrines, that we may fully embrace the high-priestly role of Christ. May we be willing to cut ties with the world and boldly proclaim the transformative power of Your Gospel. Guide us, Lord, as we seek to mature in our faith and become teachers who can lead others to You. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: What Paul was saying here is that these Jewish Christians were immature. Paul says that by this time they should have been teaching others, but they had not applied the basics to their own lives. They were reluctant to move beyond their old traditions, their established doctrines, and discussions of the basics. Paul is saying they would not be able to understand the high-priestly role of Christ unless they moved out of their comfort zone. They would have to cut some of their Jewish ties and stop trying to blend in with their culture. If we are truly committed to Christ, He will move us out of our comfort zone.
subject: Leaving Comfort Zones to Grow in Christ
verse_text: We have much to say about this, but it is hard to explain because you are slow to learn. In fact, though by this time you ought to be teachers, you need someone to teach you the elementary truths of God's Word all over again. You need milk, not solid food! Anyone who lives on milk, being still an infant, is not acquainted with the teaching about righteousness...

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Don't compare your life to others. You have no idea 
what their journey is all about...

Our Meditation for Today:

Anyone who lives on milk, being still an infant, is not 
acquainted with the teaching about righteousness.

But solid food is for the mature, who by constant use have 
trained themselves to distinguish good from evil...(Heb. 5:13, 14) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

In order to become mature Christians we need to learn discernment.
We must train our conscience, our senses, our mind, and our body 
to distinguish good from evil...

Are you able to recognize temptation before it traps you?

Can you tell the difference between a correct use of Scripture and 
a mistaken use?

Our ability understand the deeper knowledge of God, is the determining
factor in our spiritual growth...

To often we want God's banquet before we are spiritually capable of digesting it...

As you grow in the Lord and put into practice what you have learned, your
capacity to understand will also grow...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your Word
I pray that I would continue to grow in wisdom so
that I may truly feast on Your Word...Instill in me a
greater love for You and Your Word...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: In order to become mature Christians we need to learn discernment. We must train our conscience, our senses, our mind, and our body to distinguish good from evil. Are you able to recognize temptation before it traps you? Can you tell the difference between a correct use of Scripture and a mistaken use? Our ability understand the deeper knowledge of God, is the determining factor in our spiritual growth. To often we want God's banquet before we are spiritually capable of digesting it. As you grow in the Lord and put into practice what you have learned, your capacity to understand will also grow.
original_verse_text: Anyone who lives on milk, being still an infant, is not acquainted with the teaching about righteousness. But solid food is for the mature, who by constant use have trained themselves to distinguish good from evil.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, seeking to grow in discernment and spiritual maturity. Help us to train our senses, our minds, and our hearts to distinguish good from evil, to recognize temptation, and to rightly handle Your Word. May we not crave the deeper knowledge of You before we are ready, but rather, let us faithfully put into practice what we have learned, that our capacity to understand Your ways may increase. Guide us, Lord, as we strive to become mature followers of Christ. Amen.
reflection: In order to become mature Christians, we need to learn discernment. We must train our conscience, our senses, our mind, and our body to distinguish good from evil. Are you able to recognize temptation before it traps you? Can you tell the difference between a correct use of Scripture and a mistaken use? Our ability to understand the deeper knowledge of God is the determining factor in our spiritual growth. Too often, we want God's banquet before we are spiritually capable of digesting it. As you grow in the Lord and put into practice what you have learned, your capacity to understand will also grow.
subject: Grow in Discernment to Mature in Christ
verse_text: Anyone who lives on milk, being still an infant, is not acquainted with the teaching about righteousness. But solid food is for the mature, who by constant use have trained themselves to distinguish good from evil.

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~If a relationship has to be secret, you shouldn't be in it...

Our Meditation for Today:

Therefore let us leave the elementary teachings about Christ 
and go on to maturity, not laying again the foundation of repentance from acts that lead to death, and of faith in God,

instruction about baptism, the laying on of hands, the resurrection of the dead, and eternal judgment...(Heb. 6:1, 2) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Certain basic teachings are essential for all believers to understand.
Those basics include:
The importance of faith, 
The foolishness of trying to be saved by good deeds, 
The meaning of baptism and the spiritual gifts, 
And the facts of the resurrection and eternal life...

To go on to maturity in our understanding, we need to move beyond
(but not away from) the basic teachings to a more complete understanding
of the faith...

Mature Christians should be teaching new Christians the basics. Then,
acting on what they know, the mature will learn even more from God's
Word...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Lord, I thank you for the gift of faith, but I pray for
a greater sensitivity to Your Holy Spirit's teaching so that
I may grow in wisdom enabling me to have a great understanding of Your will...Bless my e-mail friends with 
good health and safety...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: Certain basic teachings are essential for all believers to understand. Those basics include: The importance of faith, The foolishness of trying to be saved by good deeds, The meaning of baptism and the spiritual gifts, And the facts of the resurrection and eternal life. To go on to maturity in our understanding, we need to move beyond (but not away from) the basic teachings to a more complete understanding of the faith. Mature Christians should be teaching new Christians the basics. Then, acting on what they know, the mature will learn even more from God's Word.
original_verse_text: Therefore let us leave the elementary teachings about Christ and go on to maturity, not laying again the foundation of repentance from acts that lead to death, and of faith in God, instruction about baptism, the laying on of hands, the resurrection of the dead, and eternal judgment.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the essential truths of the Christian faith that are laid out in Your Word. Help us to grow in our understanding of these foundational teachings, not to move away from them, but to build upon them and go deeper in our knowledge and application of Your truth. Guide us, Lord, as we seek to mature in our faith, that we may teach the basics to new believers and learn more ourselves from Your rich and life-giving Scriptures. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Certain basic teachings are essential for all believers to understand. Those basics include: the importance of faith, the foolishness of trying to be saved by good deeds, the meaning of baptism and the spiritual gifts, and the facts of the resurrection and eternal life. To go on to maturity in our understanding, we need to move beyond (but not away from) the basic teachings to a more complete understanding of the faith. Mature Christians should be teaching new Christians the basics. Then, acting on what they know, the mature will learn even more from God's Word.
subject: Grow in Faith: Move Beyond Basics
verse_text: Therefore let us leave the elementary teachings about Christ and go on to maturity, not laying again the foundation of repentance from acts that lead to death, and of faith in God, instruction about baptism, the laying on of hands, the resurrection of the dead, and eternal judgment.

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Everything can change in the blink of an eye.
But don't worry; God never blinks...

Our Meditation for Today:

It is impossible for those who have once been enlightened,
Who have tasted the heavenly gift,
Who have shared in the Holy Spirit,

Who have tasted the goodness of the Word of God
and the powers of the coming age,

If they fall away, to be brought back to repentance.
Because to their loss they are crucifying the Son of God
all over again and subjecting Him to public disgrace......(Heb. 6:4-6) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

These verses point out the danger of the Hebrew Christians'
returning to Judaism and thus committing apostasy...

Some today apply this text to unbelievers who renounce their
Christianity, or to unbelievers who come close to salvation and
then turn away...

Either way, those who reject Christ will not be saved. Christ died 
once for all. He will not be crucified again, Apart from His cross, 
there is no possible way of salvation...

The author of this text is warning against the hardness of the heart
that will make repentance inconceivable for the sinner...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank you for the gift of eternal life
which is mine by faith in the finished work of Your Son or Lord
Jesus Christ...I pray that the Holy Spirit would be able to soften 
the hearts of those who have not accepted Christ as Savior...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the Prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: These verses point out the danger of the Hebrew Christians' returning to Judaism and thus committing apostasy. Some today apply this text to unbelievers who renounce their Christianity, or to unbelievers who come close to salvation and then turn away. Either way, those who reject Christ will not be saved. Christ died once for all. He will not be crucified again, Apart from His cross, there is no possible way of salvation. The author of this text is warning against the hardness of the heart that will make repentance inconceivable for the sinner.
original_verse_text: It is impossible for those who have once been enlightened, Who have tasted the heavenly gift, Who have shared in the Holy Spirit, Who have tasted the goodness of the Word of God and the powers of the coming age, If they fall away, to be brought back to repentance. Because to their loss they are crucifying the Son of God all over again and subjecting Him to public disgrace.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging the gravity of rejecting Your Son, our Lord Jesus Christ. May we never harden our hearts to the point where repentance becomes inconceivable. Strengthen our faith, Lord, that we may cling to the cross of Christ, the only way of salvation. Keep us steadfast in our devotion to You, that we may not fall away, but instead, grow in our love and obedience to You. Amen.
reflection: These verses point out the danger of the Hebrew Christians' returning to Judaism and thus committing apostasy. Some today apply this text to unbelievers who renounce their Christianity, or to unbelievers who come close to salvation and then turn away. Either way, those who reject Christ will not be saved. Christ died once for all. He will not be crucified again. Apart from His cross, there is no possible way of salvation. The author of this text is warning against the hardness of the heart that will make repentance inconceivable for the sinner.
subject: The Danger of Apostasy and Hardened Hearts
verse_text: It is impossible for those who have once been enlightened, Who have tasted the heavenly gift, Who have shared in the Holy Spirit, Who have tasted the goodness of the Word of God and the powers of the coming age, If they fall away, to be brought back to repentance. Because to their loss they are crucifying the Son of God all over again and subjecting Him to public disgrace.

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Life is too short for long pity parties.
So get busy living, or get busy dying...

Our Meditation for Today:

If they fall away to be brought back to repentance,
because to their loss they are crucifying the Son
of God all over again and subjecting Him to public 
disgrace...(Heb. 6:6) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

This verse points to the danger of the Hebrew Christians' returning to
Judaism and so committing apostasy...

There are those who apply this verse to superficial believers who renounce
their Christianity or to unbelievers who come close to salvation and the turn
away...

Either way, those who reject Christ will not be saved. Christ died once for all.
He will not be crucified again. Apart from His cross, there is no other possible
way of salvation...

The author is warning against the hardness of heart that would make repentance 
inconceivable for the sinner...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for another new day. 
I thank You for the one sure way to inherit eternal life.
I thank You for Your grace and mercy. I pray that You
would enlighten my heart, that I may not sin against You.
I pray for good health and safety for all my e-mail friends...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: This verse points to the danger of the Hebrew Christians' returning to Judaism and so committing apostasy. There are those who apply this verse to superficial believers who renounce their Christianity or to unbelievers who come close to salvation and the turn away. Either way, those who reject Christ will not be saved. Christ died once for all. He will not be crucified again. Apart from His cross, there is no other possible way of salvation. The author is warning against the hardness of heart that would make repentance inconceivable for the sinner.
original_verse_text: If they fall away to be brought back to repentance, because to their loss they are crucifying the Son of God all over again and subjecting Him to public disgrace.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with reverence and humility, recognizing the gravity of rejecting Your Son, our Lord Jesus Christ. Help us to hold fast to the truth of the gospel, never turning away from the salvation offered through His sacrifice on the cross. May our hearts remain soft and responsive to Your Spirit, ever ready to repent and return to You. Forgive us for the times we have wavered in our faith, and strengthen us to persevere in the face of temptation and doubt. We trust in Your unfailing love and the power of the cross to redeem us. Amen.
reflection: This verse points to the danger of the Hebrew Christians' returning to Judaism and so committing apostasy. There are those who apply this verse to superficial believers who renounce their Christianity or to unbelievers who come close to salvation and then turn away. Either way, those who reject Christ will not be saved. Christ died once for all. He will not be crucified again. Apart from His cross, there is no other possible way of salvation. The author is warning against the hardness of heart that would make repentance inconceivable for the sinner.
subject: The Danger of Rejecting Christ's Sacrifice
verse_text: If they fall away to be brought back to repentance, because to their loss they are crucifying the Son of God all over again and subjecting Him to public disgrace.

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~You can get through anything if you stay put in today.

Our Meditation for Today:

Land that drinks in the rain often falling on it and that produces 
a crop useful to those for whom it is farmed receives the blessing 
of God...

But land that produces thorns and thistles is worthless and is in 
danger of being cursed. In the end it will be burned...(Heb. 6:7, 8) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Land that produces a good crop receives loving care, but land that
produces thistles and thorns has to be burned so the farmer can start 
over...

An unproductive Christian life falls under God's condemnation...

We are not saved by our deeds or conduct, but what we do is
the evidence of our faith...


Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I come to you seeking sensitivity and
obedience that I would live a life of Christ-like love and obedience...
I pray for a loving relationship with You and all other believers...
Bless my e-mail friends again today with good health and the 
strength to live another day...

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: Land that produces a good crop receives loving care, but land that produces thistles and thorns has to be burned so the farmer can start over. An unproductive Christian life falls under God's condemnation. We are not saved by our deeds or conduct, but what we do is the evidence of our faith.
original_verse_text: Land that drinks in the rain often falling on it and that produces a crop useful to those for whom it is farmed receives the blessing of God. But land that produces thorns and thistles is worthless and is in danger of being cursed. In the end it will be burned.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that our lives are like the land that produces crops. Help us to bear the fruit of righteousness, nourished by Your loving care and the power of Your Spirit. May our actions and conduct be the evidence of our faith in You, not the basis of our salvation. Cleanse us from all unproductiveness and transform us, that we may bring glory to Your name. Amen.
reflection: Land that produces a good crop receives loving care, but land that produces thistles and thorns has to be burned so the farmer can start over. An unproductive Christian life falls under God's condemnation. We are not saved by our deeds or conduct, but what we do is the evidence of our faith.
subject: Cultivating a Fruitful Christian Life
verse_text: Land that drinks in the rain often falling on it and that produces a crop useful to those for whom it is farmed receives the blessing of God. But land that produces thorns and thistles is worthless and is in danger of being cursed. In the end it will be burned.

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~It's never too late to have a happy childhood.
But the second one is up to you and no one else.

Our Meditation for Today:

God is not unjust; He will not forget your work and the love
you have shown Him as you have helped His people and
continue to help them...(Heb. 6:10) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

It is easy to get discouraged, thinking that God has forgotten us.
But God is never unjust. He never forgets or overlooks our hard
work for Him...

Presently you may not be receiving rewards and acclaim, but 
God knows your efforts of love and ministry...

Let God's love for you and His intimate knowledge of your service
for Him bolster you as you face disappointment and rejection here
on earth...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, the creator and sustainer of all that exists.
I thank You that You are always there for me during difficult times.
I thank You for Your loving kindness, and forgiveness...Place Your
protective hand upon each and everyone of my e-mail friends...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: It is easy to get discouraged, thinking that God has forgotten us. But God is never unjust. He never forgets or overlooks our hard work for Him. Presently you may not be receiving rewards and acclaim, but God knows your efforts of love and ministry. Let God's love for you and His intimate knowledge of your service for Him bolster you as you face disappointment and rejection here on earth.
original_verse_text: God is not unjust; He will not forget your work and the love you have shown Him as you have helped His people and continue to help them.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that You are never unjust or forgetful of our labor and love for Your kingdom. Even when we face disappointment and rejection, we know that You see our efforts and are intimately aware of our service to You. Fill us with Your peace that surpasses all understanding, and help us to trust in Your perfect timing and plan. May we find strength and encouragement in the knowledge that our work for You is never in vain. Amen.
reflection: It is easy to get discouraged, thinking that God has forgotten us. But God is never unjust. He never forgets or overlooks our hard work for Him. Presently, you may not be receiving rewards and acclaim, but God knows your efforts of love and ministry. Let God's love for you and His intimate knowledge of your service for Him bolster you as you face disappointment and rejection here on earth.
subject: Trusting God's Timing When Discouraged
verse_text: God is not unjust; He will not forget your work and the love you have shown Him as you have helped His people and continue to help them.

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Burn the candles, use the nice sheets, wear the fancy lingerie.
Don't save it for a special occasion. Today is special.

Our Meditation for Today:

We want each of you to show the same diligence to the very end,
in order to make your hope sure...

We do not want you to become lazy, but to imitate those who
through faith and patience inherit what has been promised...(Heb. 6:11, 12) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Hope keeps the Christian from becoming lazy or feeling bored.
Like an athlete, train hard and run well, remembering the reward
that lies ahead...

Remember Phil 3:14, I press on toward the goal to win the prize 
for which God has called me heavenward in Christ Jesus...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I pray for continued strength and faithfulness
in order that I may one day receive the prize You have prepared for
me. Continue to bless and strengthen my e-mail friends I pray in
Jesus name...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather...
original_reflection_text: Hope keeps the Christian from becoming lazy or feeling bored. Like an athlete, train hard and run well, remembering the reward that lies ahead. Remember Philippians 3:14, I press on toward the goal to win the prize for which God has called me heavenward in Christ Jesus.
original_verse_text: We want each of you to show the same diligence to the very end, in order to make your hope sure. We do not want you to become lazy, but to imitate those who through faith and patience inherit what has been promised.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging the hope that You have instilled within us. Like the athletes of old, may we run the race with perseverance, pressing on towards the goal of the upward call in Christ Jesus. Grant us the strength and discipline to train diligently, never becoming complacent or weary in our pursuit of the prize that awaits us in Your eternal kingdom. May our eyes remain fixed on the reward that You have prepared for us, that we may run with endurance and finish the course with joy. In Your Son's name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: Hope keeps the Christian from becoming lazy or feeling bored. Like an athlete, train hard and run well, remembering the reward that lies ahead. Remember Philippians 3:14, “I press on toward the goal to win the prize for which God has called me heavenward in Christ Jesus.”
subject: Pursue the Prize Ahead with Hope
verse_text: We want each of you to show the same diligence to the very end, in order to make your hope sure. We do not want you to become lazy, but to imitate those who through faith and patience inherit what has been promised.

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Over prepare, then go with the flow...

Our Meditation for Today:

When God made His promise to Abraham, since there was no one
greater for Him to swear by, He swore by Himself,

Saying "I will surely bless you and give you many descendents."

And so after waiting patiently, Abraham received what was promised...(Heb. 6:13-15) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Abraham was very patient; it was 25 years from the time God had promised
him a son (Gen. 7; 13:14-16; 15:4, 5; 17:16) to Isaac's birth (Gen. 21:1-3)...

Because our trials and temptations are often so intense. they seem to last for an
eternity.

Both the Bible and the testimony of mature Christians encourage us to wait for God 
to act in His timing, even when our needs seem too great to wait any longer...

So let us take time today to pray for patience, 
because God knows what is best for us...

Keep looking up with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: Abraham was very patient; it was 25 years from the time God had promised him a son (Genesis 7; 13:14-16; 15:4, 5; 17:16) to Isaac's birth (Genesis 21:1-3). Because our trials and temptations are often so intense. they seem to last for an eternity. Both the Bible and the testimony of mature Christians encourage us to wait for God to act in His timing, even when our needs seem too great to wait any longer.
original_verse_text: When God made His promise to Abraham, since there was no one greater for Him to swear by, He swore by Himself, Saying "I will surely bless you and give you many descendants." And so after waiting patiently, Abraham received what was promised.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with hearts filled with patience and trust, just as Your servant Abraham displayed. Though our trials may seem to last an eternity, we are reminded of Your perfect timing and the fulfillment of Your promises. Help us to wait upon You, even when our needs feel overwhelming, for You are faithful and will accomplish Your purposes in our lives. May we find strength and encouragement in the examples of those who have gone before us. We pray this in the name of Your Son, Jesus Christ. Amen.
reflection: Abraham was very patient; it was 25 years from the time God had promised him a son (Genesis 12:7; 13:14-16; 15:4, 5; 17:16) to Isaac's birth (Genesis 21:1-3). Because our trials and temptations are often so intense, they seem to last for an eternity. Both the Bible and the testimony of mature Christians encourage us to wait for God to act in His timing, even when our needs seem too great to wait any longer.
subject: Waiting on God's Perfect Timing
verse_text: When God made His promise to Abraham, since there was no one greater for Him to swear by, He swore by Himself, Saying “I will surely bless you and give you many descendants.” And so after waiting patiently, Abraham received what was promised.

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Be eccentric now. Don't wait for old age to wear purple.

Our Meditation for Today:

Because God wanted to make the unchanging nature of 
His purpose very clear to the heirs of what was promised,
He confirmed it with an oath...

God did this so that, by two unchangeable things in which
it is impossible for God to lie, we who have fled to take hold
of the hope offered to us may be greatly encouraged...(Heb. 6:17, 18) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

These two unchangeable things mentioned here are God's promise and 
His oath. God embodies all truth; so, He cannot lie. Because God is truth, 
you can be secure in His promise; you don't need to wonder if He will
change His plans...

Our hope is secure and immovable, anchored in God, just as a ship's
anchor holds firmly to the seabed...

To the true seeker who comes to God in belief, God gives an unconditional
promise of acceptance. When you ask God with openness, honestly, and 
sincerity to save you from your sins He will do it...

This truth should give you encouragement, assurance, and confidence...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the assurance that You
are a Just and Holy God. I thank You for this encouraging thought.
I thank You for the promise that You do forgive me of my sins.
So once again Lord, I come before You seeking forgiveness for 
all the sins I have committed...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: These two unchangeable things mentioned here are God's promise and His oath. God embodies all truth; so, He cannot lie. Because God is truth, you can be secure in His promise; you don't need to wonder if He will change His plans. Our hope is secure and immovable, anchored in God, just as a ship's anchor holds firmly to the seabed. To the true seeker who comes to God in belief, God gives an unconditional promise of acceptance. When you ask God with openness, honestly, and sincerity to save you from your sins He will do it. This truth should give you encouragement, assurance, and confidence.
original_verse_text: Because God wanted to make the unchanging nature of His purpose very clear to the heirs of what was promised, He confirmed it with an oath. God did this so that, by two unchangeable things in which it is impossible for God to lie, we who have fled to take hold of the hope offered to us may be greatly encouraged.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, clinging to the unshakable truth of Your promises and the steadfastness of Your love. Your Word declares that nothing can separate us from Your love in Christ Jesus our Lord. We find our hope and security firmly anchored in You, the God of all truth who cannot lie. Fill us with the assurance that Your plans for us are unchanging, that Your acceptance of us is unconditional, and that Your salvation is freely given to all who seek You with openness and sincerity. May this truth empower us to walk in confidence, knowing that our lives are secure in Your loving embrace. Amen.
reflection: These two unchangeable things mentioned here are God's promise and His oath. God embodies all truth; so, He cannot lie. Because God is truth, you can be secure in His promise; you don't need to wonder if He will change His plans. Our hope is secure and immovable, anchored in God, just as a ship's anchor holds firmly to the seabed. To the true seeker who comes to God in belief, God gives an unconditional promise of acceptance. When you ask God with openness, honesty, and sincerity to save you from your sins, He will do it. This truth should give you encouragement, assurance, and confidence.
subject: Secure Hope in God's Unchanging Promise
verse_text: Because God wanted to make the unchanging nature of His purpose very clear to the heirs of what was promised, He confirmed it with an oath. God did this so that, by two unchangeable things in which it is impossible for God to lie, we who have fled to take hold of the hope offered to us may be greatly encouraged.

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~No one is in charge of your happiness except you...

Our Meditation for Today:

We have this hope as an anchor for the soul, firm and secure.
It enters the inner sanctuary behind the curtain,

where Jesus, who went before us, has entered on our behalf.
He has become a high priest forever, in the order of Melchizedek...(Heb. 6:19, 20) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

A curtain hung across the entrance from the Holy Place to the
Most Holy Place, the two innermost rooms of the Temple...

This curtain prevented anyone from entering, gazing into, or even
getting a fleeting glimpse of the interior of the Most Holy Place...

The high priest could enter there only once a year to stand in God's 
presence and atone for the sins of the entire nation...

But Christ is in God's presence at all times, not just once a year, 
as the High Priest who can continually intercede for us...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for that "Old Rugged Cross"
which fulfilled all righteousness, clearing the path to eternal life.
I pray that the preaching of the cross and Christ's redeeming blood
would once again be the main message of every Christian Church...Amen

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: A curtain hung across the entrance from the Holy Place to the Most Holy Place, the two innermost rooms of the Temple. This curtain prevented anyone from entering, gazing into, or even getting a fleeting glimpse of the interior of the Most Holy Place. The high priest could enter there only once a year to stand in God's presence and atone for the sins of the entire nation. But Christ is in God's presence at all times, not just once a year, as the High Priest who can continually intercede for us.
original_verse_text: We have this hope as an anchor for the soul, firm and secure. It enters the inner sanctuary behind the curtain, where Jesus, who went before us, has entered on our behalf. He has become a high priest forever, in the order of Melchizedek.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we are in awe of the privilege we have to approach Your throne of grace through the work of Your Son, our High Priest, Jesus Christ. Thank You for tearing the veil that once separated us from Your presence, granting us full access to commune with You. May we hold fast to the hope we have in Christ, our anchor for the soul, who has secured our eternal salvation. In His name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: A curtain hung across the entrance from the Holy Place to the Most Holy Place, the two innermost rooms of the Temple. This curtain prevented anyone from entering, gazing into, or even getting a fleeting glimpse of the interior of the Most Holy Place. The high priest could enter there only once a year to stand in God's presence and atone for the sins of the entire nation. But Christ is in God's presence at all times, not just once a year, as the High Priest who can continually intercede for us.
subject: The Curtain Torn: Christ's Eternal Presence
verse_text: We have this hope as an anchor for the soul, firm and secure. It enters the inner sanctuary behind the curtain, where Jesus, who went before us, has entered on our behalf. He has become a high priest forever, in the order of Melchizedek.

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Frame every so-called disaster with these words: 
"In five years, will this matter?"

Our Meditation for Today:

For when there is a change of the priesthood, there 
must also be a change of the law...

He of whom these things are said belong to a different
tribe, and no one from that tribe has ever served at the
altar...

For it is clear that our Lord descended from Judah, and 
in regard to that tribe Moses said nothing about priests...
(Heb. 7:12-14) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Jesus' high-priestly role was superior to that of any priest of Levi,
because the Messiah was a priest of a higher order (Ps. 110:4)...

If the Jewish priests and their laws had been able to save people,
why would God need to send Christ as a priest, who came not from
the tribe of Levi (the priestly tribe) but from the tribe of Juda?

The animal sacrifices had to be repeated, and they offered only
temporary forgiveness; but Christ's sacrifice was offered once, 
and it offers total and permanent forgiveness...

Under the new covenant, the levitical priesthood was canceled in
favor of Christ's role as High Priest...

Because Christ is our High Priest, we need to pay attention to Him.
No minister, no leader, or Christian friend can substitute for Christ's
work and for His role in our Salvation...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the Gift of eternal
life, that is mine because of Christ's shed blood on the 
cross...I thank You for the fact that His sacrifice is once,
and for all...I thank You for the cleansing power of that 
precious blood...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: Jesus' high-priestly role was superior to that of any priest of Levi, because the Messiah was a priest of a higher order (Psalm 110:4). If the Jewish priests and their laws had been able to save people, why would God need to send Christ as a priest, who came not from the tribe of Levi (the priestly tribe) but from the tribe of Juda? The animal sacrifices had to be repeated, and they offered only temporary forgiveness; but Christ's sacrifice was offered once, and it offers total and permanent forgiveness. Under the new covenant, the levitical priesthood was canceled in favor of Christ's role as High Priest. Because Christ is our High Priest, we need to pay attention to Him. No minister, no leader, or Christian friend can substitute for Christ's work and for His role in our Salvation.
original_verse_text: For when there is a change of the priesthood, there must also be a change of the law. He of whom these things are said belong to a different tribe, and no one from that tribe has ever served at the altar. For it is clear that our Lord descended from Judah, and in regard to that tribe Moses said nothing about priests.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for the superior and eternal priesthood of Your Son, Jesus Christ. We are in awe of His sacrifice, which offers complete and lasting forgiveness, surpassing the temporary atonement provided by the Levitical priests. Lord, help us to fix our eyes on Christ, our true High Priest, and to find our salvation in Him alone, not in any human intermediary. May we always honor and obey Your Son, the Messiah, who has established a new and better covenant with us. Amen.
reflection: Jesus' high-priestly role was superior to that of any priest of Levi, because the Messiah was a priest of a higher order (Psalm 110:4). If the Jewish priests and their laws had been able to save people, why would God need to send Christ as a priest, who came not from the tribe of Levi (the priestly tribe) but from the tribe of Judah? The animal sacrifices had to be repeated, and they offered only temporary forgiveness; but Christ's sacrifice was offered once, and it offers total and permanent forgiveness. Under the new covenant, the Levitical priesthood was canceled in favor of Christ's role as High Priest. Because Christ is our High Priest, we need to pay attention to Him. No minister, no leader, or Christian friend can substitute for Christ's work and for His role in our salvation.
subject: The Superior High Priest
verse_text: For when there is a change of the priesthood, there must also be a change of the law. He of whom these things are said belong to a different tribe, and no one from that tribe has ever served at the altar. For it is clear that our Lord descended from Judah, and in regard to that tribe Moses said nothing about priests.

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Always choose life...

Our Meditation for Today:

The former regulation is set aside because it was weak
and useless...

(for the law made nothing perfect), and a better hope is 
introduced, by which we draw near to God...(Heb. 7:18, 19) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

The law was never meant to save people, but to point out sin (Ro. 3:20; 5:20)
and to point toward Christ (as we see by Gal. 3:24, 25). Salvation comes
through Christ, whose sacrifice brings forgiveness of our sins...

Being ethical, working diligently to help others, and giving to charitable causes 
are all commendable, but all of our good deeds cannot save us or make us 
right with God. There is a "better hope."

Our Prayer for Today:
Most Gracious Heavenly Father, by Your grace we can
inherit eternal life for which I am eternally thankful. May
Your grace flow freely and bring to repentance those who
are searching...Bless all my e-mail friends today with the
peace that passeth all understanding...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: The law was never meant to save people, but to point out sin (Romans 3:20; 5:20) and to point toward Christ (as we see by Galatians 3:24, 25). Salvation comes through Christ, whose sacrifice brings forgiveness of our sins. Being ethical, working diligently to help others, and giving to charitable causes are all commendable, but all of our good deeds cannot save us or make us right with God. There is a "better hope."
original_verse_text: The former regulation is set aside because it was weak and useless. (for the law made nothing perfect), and a better hope is introduced, by which we draw near to God.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging that the law cannot save us, but only points us to our need for a Savior. We are grateful for the “better hope” we have in Jesus Christ, whose sacrifice brings forgiveness and reconciliation with You. Help us to rely not on our own works, but on the grace and mercy made available through Your Son. May we ever turn to Him, the source of our salvation, and find our true hope in Your unfailing love. Amen.
reflection: The law was never meant to save people, but to point out sin (Romans 3:20; 5:20) and to point toward Christ (as we see by Galatians 3:24, 25). Salvation comes through Christ, whose sacrifice brings forgiveness of our sins. Being ethical, working diligently to help others, and giving to charitable causes are all commendable, but all of our good deeds cannot save us or make us right with God. There is a “better hope.”
subject: Salvation Through Christ's Sacrifice, Not Our Deeds
verse_text: The former regulation is set aside because it was weak and useless. (for the law made nothing perfect), and a better hope is introduced, by which we draw near to God.

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Forgive as God forgives you...

Our Meditation for Today:

Because of His oath, Jesus has become the guarantee 
of a better covenant...

Now there have been many of those priests, since death
prevented them from continuing in office;

but because Jesus lives forever, He has a permanent 
priesthood...(Heb. 7:22-24) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Now this "better covenant" is also called the new covenant
or testament. It is new and better because it allows us to go
directly to God through Christ...

We no longer need to rely on sacrificed animals and mediating
priests to obtain God's forgiveness. This new covenant is better 
because, while all human priests die, Christ lives forever...

Priests and sacrifices could not save people, but Christ truly saves.
You have access to Christ. He is available to you, but do you go to 
Him with your needs?

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the assurance of a
better covenant. I thank You that through Your Son our Lord
Jesus Christ, we can come to You at any time and you will 
hear our prayers. I thank You that there is no longer any need 
for a sacrifice... My request today is for good health, healing, 
and grace for each of my e-mail friends...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: Now this "better covenant" is also called the new covenant or testament. It is new and better because it allows us to go directly to God through Christ. We no longer need to rely on sacrificed animals and mediating priests to obtain God's forgiveness. This new covenant is better because, while all human priests die, Christ lives forever. Priests and sacrifices could not save people, but Christ truly saves. You have access to Christ. He is available to you, but do you go to Him with your needs?
original_verse_text: Because of His oath, Jesus has become the guarantee of a better covenant. Now there have been many of those priests, since death prevented them from continuing in office; but because Jesus lives forever, He has a permanent priesthood.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the new and better covenant that You have established through Your Son, Jesus Christ. We praise You that we can now come directly to You, without the need for sacrificed animals or mediating priests. Help us to fully embrace the gift of salvation that Christ offers, and to rely on Him alone as our eternal High Priest, who lives forever to intercede on our behalf. May we draw near to You with confidence, knowing that Christ has secured our forgiveness and eternal life. Amen.
reflection: Now this “better covenant” is also called the new covenant or testament. It is new and better because it allows us to go directly to God through Christ. We no longer need to rely on sacrificed animals and mediating priests to obtain God's forgiveness. This new covenant is better because, while all human priests die, Christ lives forever. Priests and sacrifices could not save people, but Christ truly saves. You have access to Christ. He is available to you, but do you go to Him with your needs?
subject: Embrace the New Covenant in Christ
verse_text: Because of His oath, Jesus has become the guarantee of a better covenant. Now there have been many of those priests, since death prevented them from continuing in office; but because Jesus lives forever, He has a permanent priesthood.

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~What other people think of you is none of your business...

Our Meditation for Today:

Therefore He is able to save completely those who come to God
through Him, because He always lives to intercede for them...(Heb.7:25) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

No one can add to what Jesus did to save us; our past, present,
and future sins are all forgiven, and Jesus is with the Father as a
sign that our sins are forgiven...

If you are a believing Christian, remember Christ has paid the 
price for your sins once and for all (see Heb. 9:24-28).

Christ makes perpetual intercession before God for us. Christ's
continuous presence in heaven with the Father assures us that
our sins have been paid for and forgiven (see Ro. 8:33, 34;
Heb. 2:17, 18; 4:15, 16; 9:24)...

This wonderful assurance frees us from guilt and from fear of failure...

Our Prayer for Today:
Thank You Lord, for the assurance of salvation. Thank Your
love and willingness to go the way of the cross in my place...
Thank you for the freedom from the guilt, and the fear of failure
that Satan would attempt to lay on me...Help me to become a 
better witness each day...Amen.

Keep looking up with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: No one can add to what Jesus did to save us; our past, present, and future sins are all forgiven, and Jesus is with the Father as a sign that our sins are forgiven. If you are a believing Christian, remember Christ has paid the price for your sins once and for all (see Hebrews 9:24-28). Christ makes perpetual intercession before God for us. Christ's continuous presence in heaven with the Father assures us that our sins have been paid for and forgiven (see Romans 8:33, 34; Hebrews 2:17, 18; 4:15, 16; 9:24). This wonderful assurance frees us from guilt and from fear of failure.
original_verse_text: Therefore He is able to save completely those who come to God through Him, because He always lives to intercede for them.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the eternal salvation that Jesus Christ has secured for us. Through His perfect sacrifice, our past, present, and future sins are forgiven, and we stand justified before You. We rejoice that Christ intercedes for us continually, assuring us of Your unfailing love and grace. May this wonderful assurance free us from guilt and fear, and empower us to live in the freedom of Your forgiveness. Amen.
reflection: No one can add to what Jesus did to save us; our past, present, and future sins are all forgiven, and Jesus is with the Father as a sign that our sins are forgiven. If you are a believing Christian, remember Christ has paid the price for your sins once and for all (see Hebrews 9:24-28). Christ makes perpetual intercession before God for us. Christ's continuous presence in heaven with the Father assures us that our sins have been paid for and forgiven (see Romans 8:33, 34; Hebrews 2:17, 18; 4:15, 16; 9:24). This wonderful assurance frees us from guilt and from fear of failure.
subject: The Eternal Forgiveness of Christ
verse_text: Therefore He is able to save completely those who come to God through Him, because He always lives to intercede for them.

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Time heals almost everything...Give time time...

Our Meditation for Today:

Unlike other high priests, He (Jesus) does not need to offer 
sacrifices day after day, first for His own sins, and then for
the sins of the people. He sacrificed for their sins once for 
all when He offered Himself...(Heb. 7:27) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Because Jesus did die once for all, He brought the sacrificial
system to an end. He forgave sins, past, present, and future...

The Jews did not need to go back to the old system because 
Christ, the perfect sacrifice, completed the work of redemption...

You don't have to look for another way to have your sins forgiven,
Christ was, and still is the final sacrifice for you...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the ultimate sacrifice,
that You made for my sins. I thank You for being my mediator,
that You stand ready to defend me before our Heavenly Father.
I pray that You would protect my e-mail friends with a hedge
of thorns from the evil one...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: Because Jesus did die once for all, He brought the sacrificial system to an end. He forgave sins, past, present, and future. The Jews did not need to go back to the old system because Christ, the perfect sacrifice, completed the work of redemption. You don't have to look for another way to have your sins forgiven, Christ was, and still is the final sacrifice for you.
original_verse_text: Unlike other high priests, He (Jesus) does not need to offer sacrifices day after day, first for His own sins, and then for the sins of the people. He sacrificed for their sins once for all when He offered Himself.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, for through the perfect sacrifice of Your Son, Jesus Christ, our sins have been forgiven once and for all. We no longer need to seek redemption through the old system, for Christ has completed the work of salvation. Lord, we praise You for this free gift of grace, and we trust in the finality of Christ's sacrifice to cover our past, present, and future transgressions. May we ever cling to the truth that there is no other way to have our sins forgiven, for Jesus is the final and perfect sacrifice. Amen.
reflection: Because Jesus did die once for all, He brought the sacrificial system to an end. He forgave sins, past, present, and future. The Jews did not need to go back to the old system because Christ, the perfect sacrifice, completed the work of redemption. You don't have to look for another way to have your sins forgiven, Christ was, and still is, the final sacrifice for you.
subject: The Final Sacrifice for Your Sins
verse_text: Unlike other high priests, He (Jesus) does not need to offer sacrifices day after day, first for His own sins, and then for the sins of the people. He sacrificed for their sins once for all when He offered Himself.

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~However good or bad a situation is, it will change...

Our Meditation for Today:

For the law appoints as high priests men who are weak; 
but the oath, which came after the law, appointed the
Son, who has been made perfect forever...Heb. 7:28) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

As we come to understand the Jewish sacrificial system better,
we will see that Jesus death served as a perfect atonement for
our sins...

His death brings us eternal life. How callous, how cold, how
stubborn it would be to refuse God's greatest gift...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Lord, the words that best explain my feeling for the
wonderful gift of salvation is, "heaven came down and glory
filled my soul---when at the cross the Savior made me whole...
My prayer is that all stubbornness in the world would be left at 
the cross so that every sin would be washed away...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: As we come to understand the Jewish sacrificial system better, we will see that Jesus death served as a perfect atonement for our sins. His death brings us eternal life. How callous, how cold, how stubborn it would be to refuse God's greatest gift.
original_verse_text: For the law appoints as high priests men who are weak; but the oath, which came after the law, appointed the Son, who has been made perfect forever.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we stand in awe of Your perfect plan of salvation, revealed through the sacrifice of Your Son, Jesus Christ. In our sinfulness, we were helpless to save ourselves, yet You demonstrated Your unfailing love by sending Christ to die for us while we were still sinners. May we never take for granted this precious gift of eternal life, but rather embrace it with grateful hearts. We praise You, our merciful and gracious God. Amen.
reflection: As we come to understand the Jewish sacrificial system better, we will see that Jesus' death served as a perfect atonement for our sins. His death brings us eternal life. How callous, how cold, how stubborn it would be to refuse God's greatest gift.
subject: The Perfect Sacrifice for Eternal Life
verse_text: For the law appoints as high priests men who are weak; but the oath, which came after the law, appointed the Son, who has been made perfect forever.

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Your job won't take care of you when you are sick.
Your friends will. Stay in touch...

Our Meditation for Today:

This is the covenant I will make with the house of Israel after
that time, declares the Lord. I will put My laws in their minds
and write them on their hearts. I will be their God, and they 
will be My people...(Heb. 8:10) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

If our heart is not changed, following God's rules will be unpleasant
and difficult. We will rebel against being told how to live...

The Holy Spirit, however, gives us new desires, helping us want to
obey God (check out Phil. 2:12, 13). With a new heart, we find that
serving God is the greatest joy...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear heavenly Father, my prayer is that more and more 
people would develop loving hearts and come to realize 
the joy of serving You. May they develop a desire to
truly obey Your laws. Bless and protect each of my e-mail
friends today...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: If our heart is not changed, following God's rules will be unpleasant and difficult. We will rebel against being told how to live. The Holy Spirit, however, gives us new desires, helping us want to obey God (check out Philippians 2:12, 13). With a new heart, we find that serving God is the greatest joy.
original_verse_text: This is the covenant I will make with the house of Israel after that time, declares the Lord. I will put My laws in their minds and write them on their hearts. I will be their God, and they will be My people.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the gift of the Holy Spirit, who transforms our hearts and gives us the desire to obey Your commands. Help us to surrender our rebellious hearts and submit to Your will, finding true joy and freedom in serving You. May our lives reflect the new life we have in Christ, as we walk in the way of Your statutes. We ask this in the name of Jesus, our Lord. Amen.
reflection: If our heart is not changed, following God's rules will be unpleasant and difficult. We will rebel against being told how to live. The Holy Spirit, however, gives us new desires, helping us want to obey God (check out Philippians 2:12, 13). With a new heart, we find that serving God is the greatest joy.
subject: Discover the Joy of Obedience with a Changed
verse_text: This is the covenant I will make with the house of Israel after that time, declares the Lord. I will put My laws in their minds and write them on their hearts. I will be their God, and they will be My people.

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Believe in miracles...

Our Meditation for Today:

No longer will a man teach his neighbor, or a man his
brother, saying know the Lord, because they will all
know me, from the least of them to the greatest...(Heb. 8:11) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Under God's new covenant, God's law is inside us. It is no longer
an external set of rules and principles...

The Holy Spirit reminds us of Christ's words, activates our conscience,
influences our motives and desires, and makes us want to obey...

Now doing God's will is something we desire with all our heart and mind...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the work of Your Holy Spirit,
activating my conscience which influences my thoughts and actions.
I thank You for His leading and guiding leading me to do God's will
day by day...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: Under God's new covenant, God's law is inside us. It is no longer an external set of rules and principles. The Holy Spirit reminds us of Christ's words, activates our conscience, influences our motives and desires, and makes us want to obey. Now doing God's will is something we desire with all our heart and mind.
original_verse_text: No longer will a man teach his neighbor, or a man his brother, saying know the Lord, because they will all know me, from the least of them to the greatest.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks that through Your new covenant, Your law is no longer an external burden, but a joyful desire written upon our hearts. By the power of Your Holy Spirit, may we know You intimately and walk in obedience to Your will, not out of mere duty, but out of a heartfelt love for You. Help us to delight in Your commands and to live as Your faithful children. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Under God's new covenant, God's law is inside us. It is no longer an external set of rules and principles. The Holy Spirit reminds us of Christ's words, activates our conscience, influences our motives and desires, and makes us want to obey. Now doing God's will is something we desire with all our heart and mind.
subject: The Heart's Desire to Obey God
verse_text: No longer will a man teach his neighbor, or a man his brother, saying know the Lord, because they will all know me, from the least of them to the greatest.

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Whatever doesn't kill you really does make you stronger...

Our Meditation for Today:

He did not enter by means of the blood of goats and calves;
but He entered the Most Holy Place once for all by His own
blood, having obtained eternal redemption...(Heb. 9:12) NIV

Our Thought for Today:


Though you know Christ, you may believe that you have to work 
hard to make yourself good enough for God. But rules and rituals
have never cleansed people's hearts...

By Jesus' blood alone (1) We have our conscience cleansed,
(2) We are freed from death's sting and can live to serve God,
and (3) We are freed from sin's power...

If you are carrying a load of guilt because you are finding that
you can't be good enough for God, take another look at Jesus'
death and what it means to you...

Christ can heal your conscience and deliver you from the frustration 
of trying to earn God's favor...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for what Christ's shed blood
means in my life...I thank You for removing the guilt of my sins...
I thank You for the healing power that comes from Christ, since
Christ came into my life...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: Though you know Christ, you may believe that you have to work hard to make yourself good enough for God. But rules and rituals have never cleansed people's hearts. By Jesus' blood alone (1) We have our conscience cleansed, (2) We are freed from death's sting and can live to serve God, and (3) We are freed from sin's power. If you are carrying a load of guilt because you are finding that you can't be good enough for God, take another look at Jesus' death and what it means to you. Christ can heal your conscience and deliver you from the frustration of trying to earn God's favor.
original_verse_text: He did not enter by means of the blood of goats and calves; but He entered the Most Holy Place once for all by His own blood, having obtained eternal redemption.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that it is through the precious blood of Your Son, Jesus, that we are redeemed and our consciences are cleansed. We no longer need to strive to earn Your favor, for it is by Your grace alone that we are saved. May we find freedom from the burden of sin and the fear of death, and may we be empowered to live in service to You. We praise You for the gift of salvation, which is ours through faith in Christ. Amen.
reflection: Though you know Christ, you may believe that you have to work hard to make yourself good enough for God. But rules and rituals have never cleansed people's hearts. By Jesus' blood alone, (1) we have our conscience cleansed, (2) we are freed from death's sting and can live to serve God, and (3) we are freed from sin's power. If you are carrying a load of guilt because you are finding that you can't be good enough for God, take another look at Jesus' death and what it means to you. Christ can heal your conscience and deliver you from the frustration of trying to earn God's favor.
subject: Freed from Guilt by Christ's Blood
verse_text: He did not enter by means of the blood of goats and calves; but He entered the Most Holy Place once for all by His own blood, having obtained eternal redemption.

original_content:
This is the day the Lord has made!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Growing old beats the alternative--dying young...

Our Meditation for Today:

The blood of goats and bulls and the ashes of a heifer sprinkled
on those who are ceremonially unclean sanctify them so they are
outwardly clean...

How much more, then, will the blood of Christ, who through the 
eternal Spirit offered Himself unblemished to God, cleanse our 
conscience from acts that lead to death, so that we may serve
the living God...(Heb. 9:13, 14) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

When the people sacrificed animals, God considered the people's faith 
and obedience, cleansed them from sin, and made them ceremonially
acceptable according to the Old Testament law...

But Christ's sacrifice transforms our life and heart and makes us clean on 
the inside. His sacrifice was infinitely more effective than animal sacrifices.
No barrier of sin or weakness on our part can stifle His forgiveness...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the cleansing power of 
the blood of Jesus Christ. I thank You for the plan of salvation
that was made available through the death of Your Son Jesus 
Christ. Accept my plea for the forgiveness of my many sins...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: When the people sacrificed animals, God considered the people's faith and obedience, cleansed them from sin, and made them ceremonially acceptable according to the Old Testament law. But Christ's sacrifice transforms our life and heart and makes us clean on the inside. His sacrifice was infinitely more effective than animal sacrifices. No barrier of sin or weakness on our part can stifle His forgiveness.
original_verse_text: The blood of goats and bulls and the ashes of a heifer sprinkled on those who are ceremonially unclean sanctify them so they are outwardly clean. How much more, then, will the blood of Christ, who through the eternal Spirit offered Himself unblemished to God, cleanse our conscience from acts that lead to death, so that we may serve the living God.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, humbled by the power and efficacy of Christ's sacrifice. Through His blood, we are cleansed from sin and made acceptable in Your sight, not by our own merit, but by the infinite worth of His offering. May we never take for granted the transformative work of the cross, which has freed us from the bondage of sin and granted us new life. Lord, continue to purify our hearts and empower us to live in obedience to Your will. Amen.
reflection: When the people sacrificed animals, God considered the people's faith and obedience, cleansed them from sin, and made them ceremonially acceptable according to the Old Testament law. But Christ's sacrifice transforms our life and heart and makes us clean on the inside. His sacrifice was infinitely more effective than animal sacrifices. No barrier of sin or weakness on our part can stifle His forgiveness.
subject: Transformed by Christ's Sacrifice
verse_text: The blood of goats and bulls and the ashes of a heifer sprinkled on those who are ceremonially unclean sanctify them so they are outwardly clean. How much more, then, will the blood of Christ, who through the eternal Spirit offered Himself unblemished to God, cleanse our conscience from acts that lead to death, so that we may serve the living God.
